name: Tabula
description: Tool for extracting tables from PDF documents into CSV or Excel formats. Tabula is a specialized tool designed to solve one specific, painful problem: extracting data tables from PDF files into CSV or Excel formats. It is widely used by investigative journalists to liberate data locked in government reports. Tabula runs locally in a web browser. Users upload a PDF, draw a box around the table, and Tabula attempts to parse the layout and extract the text into cells.
journalism_relevance: Governments love to publish budgets as scanned PDFs to hide data. These tools turn them back into Excel.

time_dividend.time_saved: No manual re-typing of budget tables.
time_dividend.reinvestment: Verify the government's totals. They often make "mistakes" in the PDF summaries.
